intro: Cynoglossum howardii, commonly known as the blueweed or blue hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Cynoglossum howardii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
